title: Part a. [0–2]
stimulusHtml:
2 points

  • One point is earned for stating that the aggregate demand will increase.

  • One point is earned for recognizing that the short-run aggregate supply is not affected.
descriptions:
Earns neither of the following 2 points

  • One point is earned for stating that the aggregate demand will increase.

  • One point is earned for recognizing that the short-run aggregate supply is not affected.

Earns 1 of the following 2 points

  • One point is earned for stating that the aggregate demand will increase.

  • One point is earned for recognizing that the short-run aggregate supply is not affected.

Earns 2 of the following 2 points

  • One point is earned for stating that the aggregate demand will increase.

  • One point is earned for recognizing that the short-run aggregate supply is not affected.

title: Part b. [0–2]
stimulusHtml:
2 points

  • One point is earned for a correctly labeled graph of aggregate demand and aggregate supply.

  • One point is earned for showing a rightward shift of the aggregate demand curve and showing an increase in both real output and the price level.
descriptions:
Earns neither of the following 2 points

  • One point is earned for a correctly labeled graph of aggregate demand and aggregate supply.

  • One point is earned for showing a rightward shift of the aggregate demand curve and showing an increase in both real output and the price level.

Earns 1 of the following 2 points

  • One point is earned for a correctly labeled graph of aggregate demand and aggregate supply.

  • One point is earned for showing a rightward shift of the aggregate demand curve and showing an increase in both real output and the price level.

Earns 2 of the following 2 points

  • One point is earned for a correctly labeled graph of aggregate demand and aggregate supply.

  • One point is earned for showing a rightward shift of the aggregate demand curve and showing an increase in both real output and the price level.

title: Part c. [0–2]
stimulusHtml:
2 points

  • One point is earned for a correctly labeled graph of the loanable-funds market.

  • One point is earned for showing a rightward shift of the demand curve for funds and concluding that the real interest rate will rise. (A leftward shift of the supply curve is accepted.)
descriptions:
Earns neither of the following 2 points

  • One point is earned for a correctly labeled graph of the loanable-funds market.

  • One point is earned for showing a rightward shift of the demand curve for funds and concluding that the real interest rate will rise. (A leftward shift of the supply curve is accepted.)

Earns 1 of the following 2 points

  • One point is earned for a correctly labeled graph of the loanable-funds market.

  • One point is earned for showing a rightward shift of the demand curve for funds and concluding that the real interest rate will rise. (A leftward shift of the supply curve is accepted.)

Earns 2 of the following 2 points

  • One point is earned for a correctly labeled graph of the loanable-funds market.

  • One point is earned for showing a rightward shift of the demand curve for funds and concluding that the real interest rate will rise. (A leftward shift of the supply curve is accepted.)

title: Part d. [0–3]
stimulusHtml:
3 points

  • One point is earned for stating that the supply of Country Z’s currency will decrease.

  • One point is earned for the explanation that the higher interest rate reduces the outflow of funds to countries that now have a relatively lower interest rate.

  • One point is earned for concluding that the value of Country Z’s currency will rise or Country Z’s currency will appreciate.
descriptions:
Earns none of the following 3 points

  • One point is earned for stating that the supply of Country Z’s currency will decrease.

  • One point is earned for the explanation that the higher interest rate reduces the outflow of funds to countries that now have a relatively lower interest rate.

  • One point is earned for concluding that the value of Country Z’s currency will rise or Country Z’s currency will appreciate.

Earns 1 of the following 3 points

  • One point is earned for stating that the supply of Country Z’s currency will decrease.

  • One point is earned for the explanation that the higher interest rate reduces the outflow of funds to countries that now have a relatively lower interest rate.

  • One point is earned for concluding that the value of Country Z’s currency will rise or Country Z’s currency will appreciate.

Earns 2 of the following 3 points

  • One point is earned for stating that the supply of Country Z’s currency will decrease.

  • One point is earned for the explanation that the higher interest rate reduces the outflow of funds to countries that now have a relatively lower interest rate.

  • One point is earned for concluding that the value of Country Z’s currency will rise or Country Z’s currency will appreciate.

Earns 3 of the following 3 points

  • One point is earned for stating that the supply of Country Z’s currency will decrease.

  • One point is earned for the explanation that the higher interest rate reduces the outflow of funds to countries that now have a relatively lower interest rate.

  • One point is earned for concluding that the value of Country Z’s currency will rise or Country Z’s currency will appreciate.

title: Part e. [0–2]
stimulusHtml:
2 points

  • One point is earned for stating that Country Z’s exports will decrease.

  • One point is earned for the explanation that the appreciating currency makes Country Z’s goods relatively more expensive.
descriptions:
Earns neither of the following 2 points

  • One point is earned for stating that Country Z’s exports will decrease.

  • One point is earned for the explanation that the appreciating currency makes Country Z’s goods relatively more expensive.

Earns 1 of the following 2 points

  • One point is earned for stating that Country Z’s exports will decrease.

  • One point is earned for the explanation that the appreciating currency makes Country Z’s goods relatively more expensive.

Earns 2 of the following 2 points

  • One point is earned for stating that Country Z’s exports will decrease.

  • One point is earned for the explanation that the appreciating currency makes Country Z’s goods relatively more expensive.
